H0.text: Finding new coal resources on Earth is one way to help slow down or stop the greenhouse effect.

H1.text: Cleaning up the litter in neighborhoods is one way to help slow down or stop the greenhouse effect.

H2.text: Cleaning up the water pollution in local lakes is one way to help slow down or stop the greenhouse effect.

H3.text: Walking or riding a bike instead of driving a car is one way to help slow down or stop the greenhouse effect.

A4.text: Increasing the concentration of GHGs in the atmosphere (due to human action) increases the natural greenhouse effect.

A5.text: The IPCC notes that individual behavioural changes alone are insufficient to achieve deep emission reductions.

A6.text: shared electric bicycle systems reduce urban transport-related carbon emissions by about 108–120 grams per kilometer

A7.text: Greenhouse gas emissions from transport are increasing at a faster rate than any other energy using sector

A8.text: The largest single source is coal-fired power stations, with 20% of greenhouse gases (GHG) as of 2021.

A9.text: Carbon dioxide (CO2), from burning fossil fuels such as coal, oil, and natural gas, is the main cause of climate change.

A10.text: Greenhouse gas emissions from transport are increasing at a faster rate than any other energy using sector.

A11.text: The bicycle is an inexpensive, fast, healthy and environmentally friendly mode of transport.

A12.text: Carbon dioxide generated in the production and transportation of the food required by the bicyclist, per mile traveled, is less than 1⁄10 that generated by energy efficient motorcars.
